title: Colors 2017

metadata.description: Learn about Colors 2017 with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Every year the
Pantone Color Institute
evaluates the colors shown by fashion designers at the New York Fashion Week.
This information is used to create The Pantone Color of the Year and the 
Pantone Fashion Color Report with the top fashion colors for the year:
Color of the Year 2017
Greenery
HEX: #92B558
Pantone 15-0343
Spring Colors 2017
Pantone told us that in the Spring of 2017 we would wear bright and vivid colors
as well as those that convey a sense of earthiness:
Niagara
HEX: #578CA9
Pantone 17-4123
Primrose Yellow
HEX: #F6D155
Pantone 13-0755
Lapis Blue
HEX: #004B8D
Pantone 19-4045
Flame
HEX: #F2552C
Pantone 17-1462
Island Paradise
HEX: #95DEE3
Pantone 14-4620
Pale Dogwood
HEX: #EDCDC2
Pantone 13-1404
Pink Yarrow
HEX: #CE3175
Pantone 17-2034
Kale
HEX: #5A7247
Pantone 18-0107
Hazelnut
HEX: #CFB095
Pantone 14-1315
Fall Colors 2017
Grenadine
HEX: #DC4C46
Pantone 17-1558
Tawny Port
HEX: #672E3B
Pantone 19-1725
Ballet Slipper
HEX: #F3D6E4
Pantone 13-2808
Butterum
HEX: #C48F65
Pantone 16-1341
Navy Peony
HEX: #223A5E
Pantone 19-4029
Neutral Gray
HEX: #898E8C
Pantone 17-4402
Shaded Spruce
HEX: #005960
Pantone 19-4524
Golden Lime
HEX: #9C9A40
Pantone 16-0543
Marina
HEX: #4F84C4
Pantone 17-4041
Autumn Maple
HEX: #D2691E
Pantone 17-1145
Downloads
The Fashion Color libraries can be downloaded from:
W3.CSS Fashion Colors

★
+1

practice_exercises.description: Create an example that applies the concepts from this tutorial.

quiz.question: Which best describes the main purpose of this c feature?
quiz.explanation: This feature serves multiple purposes in software development.

summary: This tutorial covers Colors 2017 concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use Colors 2017 effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of Colors 2017 and how to apply it in your projects.
